intro: Comeurya cumingiana, commonly known as the Cuming's spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which is characterized by its unique floral structures and milky sap. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous shrub with simple, alternate leaves and produces small, clustered flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
